{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3725317,"name":"Alexander","username":"Alexander81","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/alexander81/{size}/266894_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-28T19:29:58.535Z","cooked":"

I’ve seen teams use intricate timing belts that run through multiple pulleys. Recalc obviously doesn’t have an option for calculation of a belt running through multiple pulleys. How do teams go about doing this in cad?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2025-08-28T19:29:58.535Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":29,"reads":193,"readers_count":192,"score":243.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":505734,"topic_slug":"how-do-i-calculate-belt-size-for-serpentine-timing-belt","display_username":"Alexander","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":74791,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/how-do-i-calculate-belt-size-for-serpentine-timing-belt/505734/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3725369,"name":"Lachlan","username":"LachlanN","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/lachlann/{size}/225272_2.png","created_at":"2025-08-28T20:30:12.001Z","cooked":"

The best way I know is make construction circles for your pitch diameter of all your pulleys. Than make construction tangent lines between those circles. If your using a 5mm belt than that means each tooth is 5mm. So if it’s 100t 5mm belt than the length of it is 500mm or around 19.685 inches. Than you guess and check repeatably to get all the tangent lines and arcs of the circle to be that’s distance tweaking either a tensioner or a pulley.

is there a way to generate a double sided belt using the belt and chain gen feature script so that it can wrap around some pulleys on one face but other pulleys on the opposite face?

The Belt and Chain gen has a double sided belt toggle under the HTD and GT2 selection box . As for calculating, I believe it was 2910 who made this image which covers how to size a belt with variables .

This thread was created a while ago.

CADing Complex belts CAD
I’m trying to to CAD a belt system with multiple pulleys and several bends. I’m using Onshape, so there’s no path length dimension feature. How can I find the correct positions for the pulleys?
